snippet: Garrett Brown, the Chargers defensive tackle, was suspended without pay for the team’s first four regular-season games for violating the league’s policy on performance-enhancing substances.
abstract: NFL Roundup; San Diego Chargers defensive tackle Garrett Brown is suspended without pay for the team’s first four regular-season games for violating the league’s policy on performance-enhancing substances; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: Garrett Brown, the Chargers defensive tackle, was suspended without pay for the team’s first four regular-season games for violating the league’s policy on performance-enhancing substances.

headline.seo: Chargers Tackle Suspended Four Games by the N.F.L.
headline.main: Chargers Lineman to Miss Four Games in Suspension
headline.print_headline: Chargers Lineman to Miss Four Games in Suspension
